comm: and played uppishly first ball. A length ball shaping back in towards off, and he plays in front of his body. Lucky it hasn't carried to mid-off
swinging yorker already, on off, kept out
short of a length, tucked away off the hip for one
full outswinger, defended just outside off, to mid-off
short of a length, just outside off, shaping away, left alone. Only 129ks
short of a length, middle and off, shaping away, defended from deep inside the crease
swinging full toss, down the leg side, Moeen unlucky he doesn't get bat on it for four free runs
lovely drive. Length ball, by no means a half-volley, he stretches towards it, and drives it on the up, through the gap between mid-off and cover, all along the ground
catch it is the call as Moeen drives the ground, but it is wide enough of Lakmal to his left and goes straight of mid-on for four more
short of a length, swinging back in, punched to mid-on
full, middle and off, swinging back in, defended to mid-off
defended off the front foot, in front of off
short of a length, on off, punched down to mid-off
outswinger, just short of a driving length, defended from the crease, meets it just outside off
full outswinger again, pushed to cover-point

through his hands? No. Just wide. Short of a length, gets big on him, but he still punches at it, and gets it just to the left of Dilshan at point. Hasn't controlled this at all. Dilshan a touch slow in moving
wide of second slip. He has intended to play this open-face shot to a shortish delivery, but this one carries more than he wants it to. Past second slip anyway. No dive from third man
runs this down to third man for one
full swinging delivery, punched straight to mid-on
wide outswinger, Bell throws his arms at it, which is fair play, because the edge here is unlikely to go to hand. This one, too, flies over point for four
five wides. Lakmal has had a horror start. Big ones down the leg side. This one swings further down leg as opposed to almost every earlier delivery. They have all been moving from leg to off so far
strays onto the pads again, and he plays a pick-up shot to a length ball. Over midwicket it goes
short of a length, wide, left alone. Could have cut that one for four. Lakmal lucky here
another wide delivery allowed to go through to the keeper

nearly a screamer. Wide length ball, swinging away, he drives at it away from the body, fails to control it. Chandimal dives full length from cover-point, gets too close to the ball, and is hit sort of on the wrist

Did he offer another opportunity? Fails to control this cut, Dilshan has let one go to his left already, and this one has gone to his right. Dilshan has to go a little to his right. Almost a sitter by international standards. And he has failed to get a hand to it
full, swinging back in, driven back, and he sticks out his toe to field
really full again, slower, and beats him outside off
lovely swinging yorker, only a touch too full as it doesn't quite dip like the nastiest of the yorkers do. Kept out in front of leg
this one dips, beats his toe end, but swings too far down leg as it hits his pad
slower full ball, Moeen has seen it, and defends it solidly back to Malinga

that's a lovely shot. Malinga has missed his yorker by a few inches, and this is a low full toss. Moeen is deep in the crease, but he drives it with a slightly open face to place it between mid-off and cover
wide length ball, Bell gets a stride in, and leaves this be
length ball, angling in, Bell dabs on this, but can't beat slip
short of a length, just outside off, Bell is outside the crease to defend this
wide length ball, he has figured out Mathews' pace, and chips this one over cover
short of a length, outside off, runs this down to third man
length ball, on off, angling away, he has a late waft at it, and is lucky he doesn't edge it
outswinger, on a length, around off, defended to cover
slightly short of a length, stays a touch low, he wrists it to mid-on
strays onto the pads and pays the price. Bell nicely clips this away wide of mid-on for four
slower ball gone wrong, wide down the leg side
length ball, outside off, he is deep in the crease, runs this down to third man for one
slower ball, looks like a high full toss before dipping on him. Quite a difficult ball to face. Moeen drops his wrists and defends this to point
the first bouncer to Moeen, after he has faced 18 balls and has played himself in. That too outside leg. Malinga lucky he is not wided
wide half-volley, Bell gets a bit stride in, and drives through cover for four. He is timing them sweetly today. The DJ plays "I got a feeling/ That tonight's gonna be a good night."

one of those impossible balls to face. Looks like an outswinger, and then seams in after pitching. Bell is lucky this has bounced over the stumps. Kisses the trouser pocket along the way. Beats Sanga's dive to his left so big is the seam movement
short of a length, outside off, defended
runs this down to third man for one
looks to club him over mid-on after walking down the wicket, but mistimes it for a single to mid-on
Mathews is lucky. He has bowled this on the pads with fine leg inside the circle. Bell fails to make proper contact, and plays this to that man inside the circle
tossed up on off, defended
short of a length, angling in, punched to cover-point
flighted outside off, still quite quick, pushed to cover
into the pads, worked away wide of mid-on for one
short of a length, into the pads, worked to square leg
gets the width, cuts this, but can't beat point
looks to pull this from outside off, but this is not short enough and beats him

and a wicket from nowhere. Moeen has thrown this away. A length ball outside off, and he plays a lazy neither-here-nor-there drive. He has neither played the classic off drive along the ground looking to beat mid-off either side. Nor is this a full-blooded attempt to go over the man's head. Almost like he has changed his mind halfway through the shot and has checked that full-bloodied drive. Easy catch for mid-off. Soft dismissal from Moeen
and immediately stays back to a length ball to defend with an open face
length ball outside off, left alone
shuffles across even before the ball is bowled, leaves this alone outside off
another shuffle before leaving one alone as Mathews clocks in a wicket-maiden
punched down to long-on for one
tossed up on middle and leg, hits the inside half of the bat as he defends
another forward-defensive #digin
shimmies down to defend this back to Dilshan
pushed through this time, he goes back to drop this wide of cover for a single
stays back to defend a length-ball offbreak
wide length ball, pushed to cover-point
short of a length, looks to late-cut, is beaten
Ballance gets going. Another wide length ball, he gets close to its line and pushes it past the diving short cover, and to the right of extra cover. All along the ground
short and wide, juicy, cut straight to cover-point
short of a length, outside off, runs this down to third man
short of a length, angling in, Bell gets inside the line, and works it around the corner for one
drags this short, is pulled away to deep midwicket for one

and Ballance goes. Dilshan has woken up too with a lovely catch. Ballance plays a nothing push in front of his body, the ball doesn't turn, hits the inside half of the bat, and lobs back towards the umpire. Dilshan changes direction in follow-through and dives to his left to take the catch
short of a length, turning in, worked to leg for one
short again, and worked away for a single again
similar single past the man at short midwicket
slightly fuller, beats Bell's attempt to work this to leg
wide length ball, left alone
another sucker ball, wide, on a length, and left alone

and Root has edged this to where the regulation slip would have been. Jayawardene dives to his left, and has failed to hold on to this low offering. Regulation slip, and this would have been a sitter. He does get both hands to it, but because he is diving he fails to hold on
gentle outswinger, defended to cover
wide down the leg side this time
short of a length, he gets across to cut it to third man
short of a length, widish, defended to cover
punched down to long-on for one
defended back
turning into the pads, dropped to leg for one
stays back to work a length ball towards deep midwicket
looks to work this to leg, gets a soft leading edge back to Dilshan. And just like that, Bell has found a shell. Already down to a run a ball after a great start
under a run a ball as Dilshan puts in a dive to his right to deny them a single here
short of a length, nips back in, hits the inside half of the bat
gentle wide outswinging half-volley, and he leans into the drive to drive it past cover for four. All along the ground
short of a length, outside off, angling in, defended back to him
fuller, gets some shape away, defended from the crease
half-volley outside off, driven straight to mid-off
wide on the crease, bowls an outswinger around off, defended to mid-on
stays back to defend a flat length ball
full, pushed to long-on for one
wide offbreak, driven to deep cover for one
short, pulled away to deep midwicket
turning down leg, worked around the corner for one
and yet another single into the leg side
on a length, angling in, plays with soft hands, gets a single to leg
half-volley outside off, but driven back to Mathews
length ball, he stays back, looks to run it behind square for one but can't beat point
short of a length, angling in, worked away to deep midwicket for one
full, just outside off, pushed to short cover
short of a length, outside off, left alone
wide length ball, left alone
short of a length, pulled away, fails to control it because this is not short enough, but he has got away with it. This hasn't carried to deep square leg
short of a length, outside off, runs this down to third man for one
good single. Short of a length, just outside off, he plays with soft hands towards cover, and is off right away
runs this down to third man for one
fuller, just outside off, defended from the crease
full, on the pads, pushed for an easy single to long-on
another push to long-on for an easy single
this time an easy single to deep cover. Herath has overpitched all three of them so far
too full again, and clipped away for a single to deep midwicket
reverses this to short third for one
tossed up outside off, driven to deep cover for the sixth single of the over
short of a length, outside off, runs this down to third man for one

bowled him. Against the run of play. Bell goes back shaking his head. He has made a meal of mostly a straight half-volley. Pushes at it just outside off, and gets a big inside edge back onto the stumps. Just plays down the wrong line
digs in the bouncer, Morgan stays away from it by swaying out of its line
left alone to slip. He draws the bat out late, the ball hits the face of the bat and rolls along to slip
short of a length, outside off, left alone

aggressive field helps Morgan feel in. Full ball, the mid-off is wide to work both as mid-off and cover to spare a catching man, and he just pushes this gently down where regulation mid-off would have been. Four runs
short of a length, wide outside off, pulled away to deep midwicket
short of a length, outside off, left alone
length ball, outside off, pushed with an open face to the diving man at cover
short of a length, just outside off, defended from the crease
runs this shortish delivery to third man for one
short of a length, angling in, worked away into the leg side for a single
wide length ball, swings away a touch, left alone
Root gets away with another ill-advised pull. Again this is not short enough and he is dragging this from wide outside off. The top edge falls fine of long leg
that's a better shot, played according to the merit of the ball. Short of a length, wide, he delays the cut, comes down on it swiftly, cuts this to the right of third man for four
short of a length, outside off, runs this down to third man
on a length, middle and leg, pushed back to him
slower ball, full, easily negotiated
on a length, shaping back in towards off, pushed back to Perera
short of a length, angling in, pushed back to him
short of a length, seams back in towards the top of off, Root defends from the crease
full, shaping in, flicked away to mid-on. Four dots. Accurate bowling
short of a length, no room, neither too straight, punched to mid-on. Bowling to his field here
short of a length again, just the slightest hint of width, and Roots run this down to third man for one
full, on off, pushed down the ground but a dive from Dilshan denies the single
short of a length, punched past the diving man at short straight midwicket
flighted on off, defended back to him
down the wicket, right to the pitch of the ball, defends this back to him
pushes forward, sees a flat ball, rocks back and punches this to deep cover
misses out. This is short, the square leg is up, but he can't beat the man with the pull. This is a boundary ball gone unpunished
short of a length, angling towards off, defended to mid-off
on a length, on off, angling away, left alone
wide half-volley, driven straight to point. Should have gone for more than one at least
length ball, outside off, driven to deep cover for one
short of a length, into the pads, turned away to midwicket
short of a length, into the pads, worked away for a single past square leg
steps out of the crease to take this on the full, gets a single to deep cover
goes back to a length ball. The pressure is showing. Looking to manufacture something. Gets an inside edge
down the wicket to push this flighted delivery to long-on
stays back to work this flat delivery to leg for one
flighted around off, pushed back to Dilshan
down the wicket, Dilshan pulls the length back, Morgan pushes this to cover
on a length, shaping back in, driven straight to mid-on
short of a length, outside off, runs this down to third man for one
on a length, pitched outside leg, angling towards the stumps, played with soft hands to mid-on for one
lucky Root. Looks to go square on the off side to a ball that is not nearly short enough or wide enough. Gets an inside edge past Sanga
wide length ball, pushed straight to cover
wide half-volley, driven to deep cover for one
overpitched, pushed down to long-on for one
slog sweep. That's better from Morgan and England. Transfers some of the pressure. Smokes this for six over midwicket
gets the flatter delivery, drives it with an open face, but can't beat cover
flat, shortish, punched away for one
slightly short, looks to work this to leg, but can't beat midwicket
goes back to punch this down to long-on for one
flat, into the pads, helped along the way, on his knee to sweep it past square leg. That's 10 off 7 balls from Herath
slows this down, tosses it up, pushed down the ground, Herath gets a foot to it
flatter, pushed to the short mid-on right next to the non-striker
looks to drive this square on the off side, the ball stays low and takes a bottom edge past the stumps
down the wicket to turn this into a half-volley and drive it to long-off
full, on off, pushed back to him
full and straight again, pushed back to Malinga again
bouncer, down the leg side, and this is the second such that Malinga has got away with. That's a big wide down leg not called by the umpire
full, swinging back in towards off, dug out by Morgan
short ball, pulled away to deep midwicket for one
slower yorker, dips on him alarmingly, Root does well to keep it out
Herath is the man to be targeted. Down the wicket to drive him right back over his head for four
full and flat, defended back to him
makes room to run this shortish ball to deep point
flighted on off, driven to deep cover for one
looks to reverse this from outside leg, is beaten, gets a leg-bye even as Sanga clears his throat with a typical Sanga appeal that has little to do with reality
punched down to long-on for one
short of a length, outside off, opens the face on it
short of a length, no room, defended
short of a length, on the pads, pushed straight to midwicket
looks to work this off the pads, but it skids through and beats him for pace
on a length, on off, pushed straight back to Perera
short of a length, middle and off, runs this down to third man for one
accurate length ball, he opens the face, but can't beat point
full, on the pads, but finds midwicket this time
on a length, pitches outside leg, worked away for a single
short of a length, wide, cut away, but straight to point. Been hitting the fielders quite frequently lately
swinging in, he gets inside the line, works this fine of long leg, and comes back for a tight second, which he makes with the dive. And the dive brings up the fifty for Root
short of a length, punched straight to mid-on
nicely played. Short of a length, not too wide, he late-dabs it fine of third man
short of a length, tighter line this time, can't beat point

just before the Powerplay. Morgan had been finding the fielders with almost all his shots so far, and this time he has done it fatally so. This is short of a length, provides him the width, and Morgan goes for the cut, failing to control it. Dilshan at point is wide awake now, and takes it smoothly. Timed it sweetly, but once again hit straight to a fielder
short of a length, outside off, pushed to cover
short of a length, angling in, defended to leg
defended to cover again
driven to long-on for one
down the wicket to work this to long-on for one
wide length ball, pushed to cover
top shot. This is full, just outside off, and he has swept this square for four. All along the ground
down the wicket to push this to long-on for one
leaves his crease, gets to the pitch of the ball, pushes this wide of long-off for two
down the wicket to work this past point for one
wide length ball, pushed straight to short cover
short of a length, gets a touch big on him, punched to deep cover
short, wide, and he has drag-pulled this to deep midwicket for a couple
lovely back-cut. Perera stays short and wide - I don't know why - and he has cut this away for four
on a length, into the pads, helped away for a single
short of a length, just outside off, pushed to deep cover for one
full, into the pads, worked away for a single
short, Root stays deep in the crease, and has the time to pull this to the right of deep square leg. Sri Lanka have suddenly lost the plot in the Powerplay
yorker finally, dug out for a single to mid-on
slower ball gone wrong. Called a wide down leg. Glad to know that law applies to Malinga. Has got away with two already

would have been another wide down leg had Taylor not defended this to midwicket. Think he saw a juicy full ball outside leg, looked to glance it, but realised this was a slower ball dipping on him and all he could manage was a bunt to midwicket
full and straight, driven to long-on for one
full, into the pads, played straight to short midwicket
short, gets big on Taylor, pulled away to deep square leg
full and straight, driven straight to mid-on. Doesn't let him get under it
on a length, angling in, pushed to midwicket

misses out on a full toss. Is hit on the inside of the thigh, and to make it worse Taylor calls him for a quick single, which he has to complete with a dive. Oh boy, Sri Lanka have reviewed this. This has to be the worst review in the history of bad reviews. This has hit him so far outside leg - and is angling further - that it is missing two more sets of stumps. Oh Sanga, how did you think of this? If you didn't think of this, how did you allow this to happen? Five seconds of my life I will never get back
wide yorker, good ball, but takes a thick outside edge for four
some will call him unlucky because this has gone for four off the outside edge, but he has bowled this short and wide, and half-deserves it
yorker this time, dug out for one
short of a length, wide, runs this down to third man for one
short and wide again, lucky this time that Root has not hit this wide enough of deep cover. Gets away with just a couple
just short of a length, just outside off, runs this down to third man for another single
full and straight, he moves across to this to work it to leg, but finds short midwicket
short of a length, wide, pulled away, but finds midwicket
length ball outside off, pushed to cover-point
full and wide, drilled past cover for four. A half-volley at that pace is asking for trouble
short of a length, angling in, defended to mid-on
makes room to slog a length ball towards deep midwicket for a couple
looks to play the paddle over short fine, Lakmal bowls well, a wide length ball, and beats him attempt even as he tries to turn the bat face and look to play this towards third man at the last moment
gets a single to third man, hands over the strike to Root
a slower ball, driven to long-on for one. Fifty for this partnership
slower length ball again, looks to work this to leg, and plays it back to Mathews
short of a length, wide, cut away for a single
down the wicket to drive this to long-on for one
short of a length, wide, cut away to third man
short, into the body, pulled away for one
length ball, he makes room, drives, but straight to short cover
moves away from the stumps, Malinga bowls a wide fullie outside off and collects an easy dot
driven hard but straight to mid-off
driven again, but this time straight to point
nearly a yorker outside off, he makes room, brings the bat down on it with an open face, and squeezes it past point and straight of third man for a four
down the wicket, shortish delivery, hits it straight to point
takes a risky single to midwicket. Taylor clearly struggling to perform what is not his role
in the slot. A gentle length ball, and he has slogged it over wide long-on for a six
wide length ball, a little lazy and a little late into the drive, and is beaten

that's the hundred for Root. Short of a length, wide, he drives it on the up, with an open face, past cover-point. He drops his bat at the non-striker's end and begins to celebrate. Youngest England player to score a hundred in a World Cup match
short and wide, edges a cut fine of third man, comes back for two
Taylor has got stuck into this one. He knows Perera bowls a gentle pace, he charges at him, and picks up what he has converted into a length ball over the leg side for a big six
Taylor moves across the stumps, shows him all his poles, Perera remains full and straight, and he ends up defending it to midwicket for one
the reverse hit to the quick bowler. Three men behind square on the off side, all in the circle. He is looking to pierce it, but he has edged it for four between short third and point
he has middled this reverse shot. Perera continues bowling length, and he has played that reverse pick-up over short third for a six
slower ball, but too short, and Root has pulled this over midwicket for an easy boundary
Root give him the charge and drives, gets a thick edge, past Sangakkara. There is no third man. Goes for 25 in the over
runs down the wicket to turn this yorker into a low fullie and hands over the strike with a single to mid-off
wide full ball, but he has a deep cover in place to keep this drive down to one

full and wide, Taylor has toe-ended this drive to point. Taylor is gone for 25 off 26. The partnership has been good for England, but you could see Taylor was not at home in this role. Anyway, this brings in Buttler, who will love it from here on

oh what a beauty first up. Rises high from short of a length. Is quick, although the gun says 132ks. This has risen sharply, and has beaten his attempt to fend, and has hit him under the ear guard on the helmet. SL fielders and the umpires check on Buttler
tries another bouncer, but Buttler is a very unEnglish batsman and is ready to pull this. And manages to pull this between deep midwicket and deep square leg for four
goes for the full wide one, Buttler drives it away for a single to deep cover
bowls flat, Buttler reverse-sweeps, can't beat short third, but gets a single
in the slot, slogged away, but can't beat midwicket this time

Root has reviewed this. He has been given out lbw. Root has tried a reverse-sweep, and has missed it. This is a quicker flatter and straighter delivery. The problem with this shot it, Root is right in front of the stumps when hit by the ball, and that removes any doubt around this lbw decision. Projection shows impact in front of off, the ball clipping leg
flighted on off, defended back to him
low full toss, driven to long-off for one
wide half-volley, driven for a single. The gamble to bring Herath on works. A wicket and three runs off the over
wide and full, just inches from being a yorker, and Buttler has drilled this between deep cover and deep extra cover. This is great timing. They don't have much to move, but they have been beaten
drilled away again, but this time straight to deep extra cover
slower ball, short of a length, runs this down to third man for one
full and wide again, but this has missed the yorker by inches, and Buttler has driven this square, to the left of deep cover this time. Absolutely creamed it again
driven to deep extra cover this time
slower yorker, middle and leg, he can't do much with it, takes a single to leg
down the wicket to drive this to long-off to bring Buttler to the strike
down the wicket, is looking to go over cover, but has got too close to the pitch of the ball. Ends up driving this to long-off for one. Along the ground
keeps Woakes on strike. The slider. Woakes goes deep into the crease, but is beaten by the skidding delivery and is hit on the pad
down the wicket now, drives to extra cover, brings Buttler back on

Herath is down on the ground. Buttler gives himself room, Hearth follows him, nearly yorks him, but Buttler has drilled this right back at Herath who fails to get out of the way and is hit close to the tip of his fingers. The index finger is bleeding. He is going off
this would have been a big wide had Woakes not reached it - with the help of a ladder I think - to sort of scoop it over point for four. Went full and wide, but went too wide
fullie, high fullie, called no-ball too, and he has pulled this fullie for four to square leg
wide half-volley with mid-off up. Not the smartest thinking. Drilled between him and mid-off for four more
full and wide, beats Buttler's attempt to move across and go leg side. Squeezes it under his bat
lovely wide yorker. With a strong off-side field. This is a superb delivery. Can't do much with it. Dug back out to Lakmal, who misses out on running Woakes out, who has backed away too far
this is not fair. This is a good delivery. Full and wide again. Just six inches from being a yorker, and Buttler has managed to drill it over extra cover for a six
Lakmal will have to be taken out of the attack with the second high full toss. Is this a slower ball gone wrong? I sure hope so because otherwise this is a head-high full toss

down the wicket, too close to the pitch of the ball, driven to long-off. Woakes is coming back even if he doesn't make it two. He just wants Buttler on strike. As it turns out they take the second too because the throw is slow
makes room, and slugs this between long-on and deep midwicket for four more. A beauty from Buttler to provide England the impetus they needed
short of a length, tucked away off the hip for one
outswinger. Starts outside off. Dilshan stays inside the line
full, outside off, defended to mid-off
short of a length, outside off, cut away, but not convincingly
nice outswinger, slightly short of a length, though, and Dilshan defends from the crease
outswinger again, fuller, draws him forward, Dilshan pushes this to extra cover for one

provides Dilshan the width first ball, and Dilshan throws his arms at it. Even if this has come off a thick edge, the ball deserves to go for four because it allows Dilshan to go hard at it, and no edge is getting caught when he goes that hard
appeal for a catch down the leg side but the umpire Oxenford has made it clear from the word go that it is pad. And he is right too
wide half-volley followed by one down the leg side followed by a short ball that has been pulled away for one
full, on off, driven to mid-off
full, nearly a yorker, dug out to mid-off
clipped away off the pads for an easy single. Not a great start from Broad
short of a length, on off, defended from the crease
on a length, on off, no swing, only the angle away, defended to point
fuller, straighter, but still no swing. Defended towards mid-off
on a length, middle and leg, angling towards off, defended off the front foot
this is pitched outside leg, lets him work it away for a single past square leg
on a length, headed for top of off, Dilshan defends from the crease
bouncer, and a good sharp one too. Thirimanne ducks away
a nothing shot. A sign that the bouncer has got to him. Looks to run this shortish delivery down with two slips in place. Lucky to not have succeeded doing what he wants to

dropped. Buttler has sold Root a dummy here. Thirimanne plays another ordinary shoot, opening the face, edging it through to the left of Buttler. He starts to go for it, and it is not too far really, and then at the last moment he pulls out, and Root is on a hiding to nothing here. Dropped
defended towards point with an open face
Broad is not happy. He is angry. He bangs this one in. In his own half. Goes for four byes well over the head of the keeper. Not called a wide, though
runs this down to third man for one
drives this in front of his body, uppishly, but straight of mid-off. Thirimanne living a charmed life here
straighter, no room, defended to leg
looks for the big strike down the ground, mis-hits it back over the bowler's head
on a length, pitched outside leg, worked to midwicket for a single
short of a length, angling in, worked to square leg
short of a length, holds its line outside off, beats his edge as he looks to punch it through cover
yorker, on off, dug out by Thiri
short of a length, on the pads, but can't beat midwicket with his clip
short of a length, just outside off, pushed to point
full and straight, hit bat face turns in his attempted drive back down the wicket. Inside-edges this back to Broad. He has damaged his bat, which gets changed
bouncer, and Thirimanne ducks under it
maiden with an accurate length ball, defended from the crease by Thirimanne
short of a length, just outside off, defended form the crease by Dilshan
short of a length, just outside off, punched to cover
tucked away off the hip for a single
again, short of a length, outside leg, easily tucked away again. Comes back for two as he has placed this wide of the man deep on the leg side
short of a length, not too wide, he cuts in front of square, but finds Taylor at cover-point
bouncer, outside off, left alone by Thirimanne
short to Thirimanne has been working, but Dilshan makes Broad pay by pulling him over midwicket for a six
high full toss, Dilshan doesn't pick it, is beaten as it dips towards the end and lands past the stumps. Good take by Buttler as this takes a bad bounce and rises head high
wide outswinger, Dilshan follows it and is beaten. Nearly an edge
lovely shot. He is peppering that short square boundary on the leg side. This is just a length ball on the pads, and he plays part pick-up, port flick-pull, and clears square leg with ease
another full toss, again around knee high, flicked to mid-on
full, into the pads, clipped away past midwicket for a couple
and a lovely shot. A length ball floated up outside off, and he has driven it beautifully past cover for four
drives again but this time he finds short cover
full, angling in, driven to Broad at mid-on, and they steal the single
bouncer, higher than the shoulder but not the head, Dilshan has to work hard to control it. he manages to control the pull. Gets a single
beautiful square drive. Widish length ball, Thirimanne stands tall and drives on the up, this time to the right of cover-point
front-foot defensive to end the over
short and wide, and is lucky it doesn't come on, which means Dilshan is beaten on the cut
wide on the crease, angling in, gets good bounce, defended to mid-on
looks to pull like he did in the last over, but the ball is not short enough and he gets an inside edge onto the pad
full, nearly a yorker, on off, dug out back to him
soft leading edge as he looks to work this shortish delivery to leg
short of a length, pitched outside leg, flick-pulled to the right of fine leg for two
full outside off, driven to deep cover for one
on a length, pitched outside leg, pushed wide of mid-on for one
looks to cut but is cramped, and finds point
drives a length ball on the up, finds mid-off
short of a length, outside off, punched away to cover-point
driven back at him but not wide enough of Woakes
wide down the leg side. Not called? Umpires lenient today
short of a length, defended
this is surely a wide down the leg side. Yes it is
half-volley, on off, Thirimanne drives it sweetly to the left of mid-off for four
superb shot. Finn drops this in short, gives him no room, it seems Thirimanne is swaying inside the line of this, but at the last moment he ramps it over slip for four
on a length, pitched outside leg, defended to leg
short of a length, outside off, chips it over cover
he stays in the crease and dabs the back of length delivery on the off side, no room to play with
fuller and on the pads, Thirimanne nudges it with soft hands to pick up a single past midwicket
gets it to straighten a touch around off stump, Dilshan watches it carefully and pushes it towards point
punches this fuller delivery firmly to mid-off and takes off for a quick single. Finn was deep in the circle and couldn't prevent the run
superbly hit! Perfect balance as Thirimanne drives this through cover. It was fuller and on the slot, and Thirimanne plays a text book shot
pulls the length back, the batsman comes forward and defends to off
this one cuts in from short of length, cramps Dilshan for room as he defends it down the pitch
another one that has jagged back into the batsman! This one gets the batsman in some trouble, clips his thigh pad and rolls to the man at first slip.
he stays back to get solidly behind the line of this length ball, defends it to mid-on
tight lines these from Finn. Keeps it around off stump and marginally short of length, Dilshan has no option but to defend this to off
pitches it full on the pads and Dilshan was waiting for it, punches it superbly through midwicket for a boundary. Finn knows he has missed his line
corrects his line to outside off but Dilshan flays at it, without much timing though. Picks up a single to cover
flighted just outside off, pushed to cover
flat, short of a length, poor delivery really with the third man up. Late-cut away for four
full and flat, outside off, driven hard, but straight to cover-point
down the wicket to push this low full toss back to him
swept away square, from middle and leg, gets a single to deep square
short of a length, angling in, punched down to long-on for one
tucked away off the hip for one
leg-stump half-volley. They are providing a boundary ball every over. Clipped away off the toes, to the left of long leg
short of a length, on off, steered to third man for one
short of a length, on off, runs this down to third man for an easy single
drives on the up, can't beat cover
looks to drive this wide length ball, the bat face closes a touch, and he ends up sending it nowhere. He is upset with his effort here
on a length, middle and leg, defended back
full outside off, punched to cover
drifting in from round the wicket but too full, driven to long-off for one
half-volley on the pads, lucky he has found midwicket
goes back to a flat length ball to punch it to long-off for one
wide shortish delivery, cut away to point
full, on off, driven to mid-off
half-tracker, pulled away to deep midwicket for one
wide length ball, driven on the up to deep cover
short of a length, into the pads, clipped away for one
wide half-volley, lucky he has a deep extra cover in place
short of a length, widish, punched to cover
on a length, middle and leg, pushed to short straight midwicket
Thirimanne brings up his second consecutive fifty with a punch to deep cover
sweeps this flat delivery from middle and leg, gets a single
tossed up on middle and leg, driven to long-off for one
sharp turn as he pushes this one through. Dilshan is beaten and hit on the pad, but the ball is headed down leg

Moeen provides the breakthrough. The dip does it for him. This is full, into the pads, but it has dipped on him. The ball turns out to be shorter than Dilshan first expects it to. Ends up getting a leading edge to short midwicket
full, into the pads, driven to long-on
short of a length, into the pads, worked to leg to get off the mark
punched down to long-on uppishly
full, on the pads, clipped away for a single
another overpitched delivery, another drive down to long-off for one
finally a dot as he defends this flat length ball back to Root
tossed up on middle and leg, dropped to cover with soft hands for a single
low full toss, driven back to Moeen
overpitched, pushed to long-off for one
lovely chip shot, inside-out, over extra cover, comes back for two
full, driven down the ground, but not past Moeen's dive
misses out on a full toss, hits it back to Moeen
down the wicket to push this past short midwicket for one
into the pads, turned around the corner for one
full, into the pads, easy push down to long-on
flat and shortish with third man up, not quite the delivery, and he has opened the face at the last minute to use all the pace from Root
fuller, straighter, defended from the crease
again provides him the width, Thirimanne looks to open the face but is beaten this time
another poor ball. Short, down leg side, Sanga helps himself, pulling it past fine leg
pushed to deep cover
lovely batting. This is outside leg when he meets it, but he meets it with an open face and soft hands. Takes a single to the left of point
pushed straight to cover
full, middle and leg, pushed to long-on for one
again stays leg-side of a length ball and pushes it past point for one
length ball, angling in, driven to deep cover for one
length ball, angling across, opens the face on it, gets a single to the right of point, who dives but fumbles
opens the face to place this fine of third man for a couple
wide length ball, chipped over the infield for a single to deep cover
length ball, on off, driven to mid-on
short of a length, outside off, punched away to point
offbreak around middle and leg, played back to Mo
full on middle and leg again, another push back to Mo
driven to deep cover this time for one
tossed up outside off, pushed to long-off for one
short of a length, into the pads, pushed to midwicket
makes room to punch this length ball away from off-stump line, but can't pierce the cover ring. Some dots around now. Can England translate it into some pressure?
tucked away off the hip for one
angling in from round the wicket, goes around the corner for a leg-bye
short of a length, outside off, punched away to deep cover
bouncer, he ducks under it
looks to cut but the ball not quite short enough and beats his attempt
another bouncer, another duck under it, and there they have three more dots in a row
that will release whatever little pressure would have been built. Fired into the pads, glanced away fine of short fine leg
backs away to try to go off side but Mo follows him with a quick length ball. Played back to him
tossed up outside off this time, driven to long-off
another easy single with a push to long-off
out of nowhere tries the slog sweep to a ball too full. Lucky his edge hasn't carried to short midwicket
drives this one with an open face, past point, for a single
short of a length, angling in, dropped down towards the keeper for a single
full, driven to mid-off
short of a length, outside off, angling a touch, opens the face on it, but finds the man at point
looks to pull this short ball, gets a bottom edge onto his own body
short of a length, angling away, he helps it along its way for a single to third man
short of a length, widish, angling in, and he opens the face on it to beat third man. Thirimanne keeps finding the boundary
full, middle and leg, driven to long-on for a single
defended to him
he has been lining Mo up for this. The last time the ball was too full, but this time it is a length ball, and he gets down on a knee to slog-sweep him for six over midwicket
flatter shorter ball, punched to cover
flighted outside off, driven, but straight to cover
into the pads, helped around the corner for one
half-volley on off with mid-off up in the circle, and Thiri drives him between mid-off and the bowler
gets a single to deep cover
short of a length, outside off, pushed wide of cover for a single
short of a length, outside off, easily steered away for a single
short and wide, cut away over the head of the fielder at point. All happening too easy for Sri Lanka
old-fashioned tip and run. Short of a length, angling in, uses soft hands, drops it in front of cover and hurries through
flighted around off, opens the face, gets it past point, takes the single
got the length ball on middle and leg, went for the slog-sweep, but missed. A good choice of shot because he won't get out lbw if it is pitching leg
too full, driven down to long-off
out of the crease to chip this to long-off for one
driven along the ground to long-off
stops on him a touch as Sanga looks to work this to leg. The front edge is not healthy enough to carry it back to Mo
short of a length, middle and leg, angling towards off, he opens the face and gets a single
short of a length, at his body, no room, pushed to short midwicket
cramps him up again with a shortish delivery. Another dot
once again Finn is pretty accurate with a shortish ball. Defended back
this time Sanga gets inside the line and works this shortish delivery to leg for one
opens the face on this but can't beat the man at point
down the wicket to drive this to long-on for one
fired into the pads, punched down to long-on for one
driven with an open face, gets a single to deep cover
fired in again, and he has gone back to punch this to long-off
draws a thick edge as Sanga drives, but even that goes wide of point for a couple
down the wicket, right to the pitch of the ball, drives it to long-on for one
and now he is toying around with Finn. Dances down the wicket and flat-bats a short ball over mid-off. Clean as a whistle. Six
on the pads, worked away for one
short of a length, no room, defended with an open face
tucked away off the hip for another single
on a length, middle and leg, defended from the crease
punched away past the diving man at point for a single
this is poor bowling. Gentle short ball with fine leg up. Helped along its way for four
full, just outside off, pushed to mid-off for one
full, middle and off, hits the inside half of the bat as he looks to drive
length ball outside leg, beats him, hits the pad, concedes a leg-bye, but this involves a typical Broad optimistic appeal
and he has brought up an inconspicuous fifty with a clip off the toes past midwicket. He might have done it without screaming for attention, but he has done it at better than a run a ball
pushed wide of mid-on for one
no idea why they are bowling short to Sanga with short square boundaries. This is a soft bouncer too, rib high. Pulled away for six over square leg
looks to work this to leg, gets a leading edge past cover for one
short of a length, middle and leg, opens the face, gets a single to third man
driven on the up to long-off. The return from there is a direct hit, and they get a second through the overthrow
not showing him much respect. Dancing down the track and hitting him back over his head. Goes off the lower quarter of the bat
on a length, on off, played with an open face towards deep cover
bowls a low full toss that is driven to deep cover for one
lucky to get away with it. Short of a length, wide, with third man up in the circle. Lucky that Thiri has found Ballance there
slower length ball, beats his drive
full ball, angling in, pushed to mid-on for one
yorker gone wrong, turns out to be a low full toss on the pads, flicked away past midwicket for four
length ball, slogged away to midwicket for one
short ball to start again, and pulled over midwicket for four more
another short ball, in slightly less control of it, but he has pulled it between the two men in the deep
full outside off, dug out wide of point for one
short of a length, on the pads, Sanga wants the single, but he has played it straight to midwicket and sends him back

Sanga is more eager than Thiri. Pushed straight to cover-point, and Sanga is halfway down. Sent back. Oh, and he has changed direction while running back. If the throw hits Sanga, he is out obstructing the field

Mo has made a meal of it. This is as gentle a catch as they come in international cricket. Scooped towards cover where Moeen is caught at the ring and moves only sideways. Doesn't take the half step he needs to to take the catch. As if that 30-yard circle is a ring of fire
and there comes Thiri's hundred. Drives this to deep cover and begins to celebrate. Sanga joins him in the celebration. He is pumped up. Youngest Sri Lankan to score a WC century
drills this down the ground, straight of long-on, Root saves two runs with a dive at long-on
lovely shot. Short of a length, middle and leg, but Sanga makes room to cut it from in front of leg to beat point for a four
this time he charges at Woakes. Halfway down the wicket to loft this back over Woakes' head for a straight boundary
once again he makes room to cut him from in front of leg. This is excellent dominating batting without a hint of violence. Point has been beaten to either side now
well bowled. Yorker on off. Sanga can't do much. Digs it out for a dot
short of a length, on the pads, pushed past midwicket for one
tucked away off the pad for a single
dabbed away just wide of the keeper for a quick single, and a second with the overthrow
gets the width, punches this, but can't beat the man at point
short of a length, no room looks to dab this behind square, but plays it straight to point
a yes and no as he plays this to short third man and sends Thiri back. Both are safe, though
wide half-volley, chipped over cover
moves across, Broad fires in a yorker on middle and leg, kept out
leg-side half-volley, to Sanga, on 93 off 66, he accepts it gleefully for a four to square leg
low full toss, hit to long-on for one
short of a length, he makes room, cuts, nearly beats backward point

slugged back at him, Broad gets a boot to it, the ball goes softly towards long-off. It gives Sanga time to come back for the second to bring up his fastest hundred, beating the mark he had achieved only in his last ODI
pushed towards deep cover
makes room to take this from leg and cut this past point for four
short of a length, wide, cut away past point for four more. All too easy
yorks him up from round then wicket on middle and leg
worked into the leg side
full, middle and leg, worked to deep midwicket
full, middle and leg, he makes room to drive this to long-on
short of a length, angling in, helped around the corner for a single
low full toss, on the pads, worked away for an easy single
looks to pull but the ball hits the bat as opposed to the other way around. Gets a single to cover
nearly a yorker, dug out to long-on for one
sharp short ball, Thiri beaten by the pace again, gets a single off the top edge into the crest on his helmet
full, middle and leg, driven between long-on and long-off for two
slower ball, defeats his attempt to make room and hit through covers. Hits the toe end of the bat
short, angling in from round the wicket, pulled away to deep midwicket for one
wide down the leg side even though Broad is appealing
makes room, Broad follows him, plays this to deep midwicket for one
pulled away this time, gets a single to deep midwicket
slower short ball, pulled away to deep midwicket. That man has been busy this over
all falling apart for England. Broad beats him but Buttler fails to collect it as the ball dips on him down the leg side and then goes for four byes
mis-hit over mid-on for two more
follows him as he backs away, clipped away to deep square

slower ball, beats his shot, Thiri is early into the shot, lofts this wide of deep midwicket, Taylor makes good ground, gets both hands to it, but can't hold on. Also it trickles over the rope for four
short of a length, no room, but he arches back to make room and ramps it fine of third man for four
drives this back to him
well bowled as he sees him make room and slips this wide outside off
full outside off, driven to the left of mid-off for one
hsort ball, pulled away to deep midwicket for one
cramps him up with a shortish delivery, pulled away for a single
slower ball, on the pads, chipped away for a single
wide yorker, dug out to point
full, can't get under it, driven to deep cover for one
slower short ball, looks to cut it over cover, but is beaten
wide outside leg as he pre-empts a move away from the stumps
pushed to mid-off for a quick single
all over with a six. Thiri gets a length ball outside leg, he opens the front leg a touch and lofts him over wide long-on for a six to finish a comprehensive chase of 310 with consumnate ease
